AUN  
  
  
  AND  
     
  
UTME  
(i) AAUA requires five (5) ‘O’ level credit passes to 
include  English Language, Literature in English, 
Mathematics, one (1) Arts subject and two (2) of 
the following  CRS/IS, Igbo Language/Yoruba  
 Language/Hausa  Language,   
History/Government, French, Fine Arts or Music.  
(ii) CHRISTOPHER – Maximum of two (2) sittings.  
(iii) FED-OYEEKITI also requires five (5) ‘O’ level credit 
pass in one Science subject and at least a pass in 
Mathematics.  
(iv) KASU accepts only subjects from Arts or Social 
Sciences  
(v) KSU and ABU require f ive (5)‘O’ level credit 
passes to include English Language, Literature in 
English and three (3)other subjects in Arts or 
Social Sciences.  
(vi) NDU requires five (5) ‘O’ level credit passes in 
English Language, Literature in English and any 
other three (3) subjects, two (2) of which must be 
Arts subjects.  
(vii) UNN requires a Science subject.  
  
  
UTME SUBJECTS  
(i) ABU requires Literature in English a nd two (2) 
othersubjects in Arts or Social Sciences.
